citeinfo.origin: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC), Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis
citeinfo.title: Bathymetry from Tampa Bay to Apalachicola Bay

descript.abstract: This GIS line data set represents depth contours (bathymetry) for the offshore areas of the northwest coast of Florida from Apalachicola to the Tampa Bay, as shown in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Nautical Chart 11400. FWRI staff digitized the contours off of a clean, wrinkle-free paper chart, using the most current version of the chart that was available in 1997.
descript.purpose: To represent marine depth contours, primarily for small-scale (large area) cartographic purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information These data are not to be used for navigation. User should be aware that later versions of the source charts may be available and that contours may have changed. Consult the most recent paper or digital charts available and appropriate coast pilot. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

attracc.attraccr: All entities and attributes have been identified and documented.

dataqual.complete: Not all contours present on the chart are included in the vector data set.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Nautical Chart 11400

srcinfo.srccontr: The source chart (11400) provided depth contours measured in fathoms.

procstep.procdesc: FWRI digitized arcs off NOAA Nautical Charts and arc topology was created in ArcInfo.

attr.attrdef: Chart number from which the arc was digitized. Value is 11400

True or false for the condition chart border. 0 = false, 1 = true.

Depth of contour in fathoms. 999 = chart border 3 = 3 fathoms or 18 feet 5 = 5 fathoms or 30 feet 10 = 10 fathoms or 60 feet 20 = 20 fathoms or 120 feet 30 = 30 fathoms or 180 feet 40 = 40 fathoms or 240 feet 50 = 50 fathoms or 300 feet 100 = 100 fathoms or 600 feet 200 = 200 fathoms or 1200 feet 300 = 300 fathoms or 1800 feet 400 = 400 fathoms or 2400 feet 500 = 500 fathoms or 3000 feet

attrdomv.udom: Depth of contour in feet. 999 = chart border 18 = 18 feet or 3 fathoms 30 = 30 feet or 5 fathoms 60 = 60 feet or 10 fathoms 120 = 120 feet or 20 fathoms 180 = 180 feet or 30 fathoms 240 = 240 feet or 40 fathoms 300 = 300 feet or 50 fathoms 600 = 600 feet or 100 fathoms 1200 = 1200 feet or 200 fathoms 1800 = 1800 feet or 300 fathoms 2400 = 2400 feet or 400 fathoms 3000 = 3000 feet or 500 fathoms

overview.eaover: Each contour contains the attributes FATHOM and FEET, which represent the shallowest contour depth in the respective units. A value of 999 indicates the line is a chart border. The D-coding attributes represent contour values in feet only.
overview.eadetcit: U. S. Dept. of Commerce, National Ocean and Atmospheric Service, National Ocean Service. NOAA Nautical Chart 11400.

The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of this data set for a specific application. In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer
